trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Through math class, most middle school students are already familiar with coordinate grids and mapping x and y coordinates on a plane. To review some terms:
trans-unit.target: Through math class, most middle school students are already familiar with coordinate grids and mapping x and y coordinates on a plane. To review some terms:

trans-unit.source: Axes
trans-unit.target: Axes

trans-unit.source: The basic coordinate grid a student learns has two axes,
trans-unit.target: The basic coordinate grid 生徒 learns has two axes,

trans-unit.source: an x-axis which runs horizontally and
trans-unit.target: an ｘ軸 which runs horizontally and

trans-unit.source: a y-axis which runs vertically.
trans-unit.target: a ｙ軸 which runs vertically.

trans-unit.source: Origin
trans-unit.target: Origin

trans-unit.source: These two axes meet at a point called the origin where both the x and the y values are zero.
trans-unit.target: These two axes meet at a point called the origin where both the x and the y values are zero.

trans-unit.source: On this basic coordinate grid, the origin is in the lower left corner of the grid and has the coordinates (0,0).
trans-unit.target: On this basic coordinate grid, the origin is in the lower left corner of the grid and has the coordinates (0,0).

trans-unit.source: Coordinate pair
trans-unit.target: Coordinate pair

trans-unit.source: The first value in a coordinate pair is the x value and the second value in a coordinate pair is the y value.
trans-unit.target: The first value in a coordinate pair is the x value and the second value in a coordinate pair is the y value.

trans-unit.source: A simple way to remember which value comes first is to remember their order in the alphabet.
trans-unit.target: A simple way to remember which value comes first is to remember their order in the alphabet.

trans-unit.source: The letter x comes before the letter y in the alphabet and the x coordinate comes before the y coordinate in a coordinate pair.
trans-unit.target: The letter x comes before the letter y in the alphabet and the x coordinate comes before the y coordinate in a coordinate pair.

trans-unit.source: Coordinate value changes
trans-unit.target: Coordinate value changes

trans-unit.source: On a basic coordinate grid,
trans-unit.target: On a basic coordinate grid,

trans-unit.source: the value of the x coordinate increases left to right and is a measure of how many units a point is horizontally from the origin
trans-unit.target: the value of the x coordinate increases left to right and is a measure of how many units a point is horizontally from the origin

trans-unit.source: the value of the y coordinate increases bottom to top and is a measure of how many units a point is vertically from the origin
trans-unit.target: the value of the y coordinate increases bottom to top and is a measure of how many units a point is vertically from the origin

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/coordinates/math-coords.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/coordinates/math-coords.png

trans-unit.source: Math coordinates
trans-unit.target: Math coordinates

trans-unit.source: Coordinate grid and JavaScript and the micro:bit
trans-unit.target: Coordinate grid and JavaScript and the micro:bit

trans-unit.source: The 5 x 5 grid of LEDs on the micro:bit represent a coordinate grid with a horizontal x-axis and a vertical y-axis.
trans-unit.target: The 5 x 5 grid of LEDs on the micro:bit represent a coordinate grid with a 水平なｘ軸 and a 垂直なｙ軸.

trans-unit.source: It has an origin and you can refer to the position of the LEDs with coordinate pairs.
trans-unit.target: It has an origin and you can refer to the position of the LEDs with coordinate pairs.

trans-unit.source: It is important however that the students understand the two major differences between the micro:bit LED grid and the coordinate grid that they are used to using in math class:
trans-unit.target: It is important however that 生徒たち understand the two major differences between the micro:bit LED grid and the coordinate grid that they are used to using in math class:

trans-unit.source: the origin (0,0) is in the top left corner.
trans-unit.target: the origin (0,0) is in 左上隅.

trans-unit.source: the values of the y coordinates range from 0 through four and increase from top to bottom.
trans-unit.target: the values of the y coordinates range from 0 through four and increase from top to bottom.

trans-unit.source: Note:
trans-unit.target: Note:

trans-unit.source: The values of the x coordinates range from 0 through four and increase from left to right just as they do in the coordinate grids used in math class.
trans-unit.target: The values of the x coordinates range from 0 through four and increase from left to right just as they do in the coordinate grids used in math class.

trans-unit.target: Sidebar material

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/coordinates/rene-descartes.jpg
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/coordinates/rene-descartes.jpg

trans-unit.source: Rene Descartes
trans-unit.target: Rene Descartes

trans-unit.source: (image credit: Wikipedia Commons)
trans-unit.target: (image credit: Wikipedia Commons)

trans-unit.source: René Descartes (1596-1650), was a French philosopher and mathematician who developed the coordinate system we use today.
trans-unit.target: René Descartes (1596-1650), was a French philosopher and mathematician who developed the coordinate system we use today.

trans-unit.source: A story goes that while lying in bed, he noticed a fly on the ceiling.
trans-unit.target: A story goes that while lying in bed, he noticed a fly on the ceiling.

trans-unit.source: In wondering how he could describe the fly’s exact position on the ceiling, he decided to use a corner of the ceiling as a reference point and then describe the fly’s position as a measure of how far away from the reference point one would need to travel horizontally and then vertically to reach the fly.
trans-unit.target: In wondering how he could describe the fly’s exact position on the ceiling, he decided to use a corner of the ceiling as a reference point and then describe the fly’s position as a measure of how far away from the reference point one would need to travel horizontally and then vertically to reach the fly.

trans-unit.source: His coordinate system proved useful in many ways including creating an important link between the studies of algebra and geometry.
trans-unit.target: His coordinate system proved useful in many ways including creating an important link between the studies of algebra and geometry.

trans-unit.source: Geometric shapes could now be described by points on a coordinate plane.
trans-unit.target: Geometric shapes could now be described by points on a coordinate plane.
